page.title: 17Games in School
page.content: In Riverside Junior School many different games are played at playtimes and lunchtime break. These include Football, Skipping, Hopscotch, Cricket, Relievo, 'Tig' of all sorts, Sevenses, Elastic Twist, Wallie Ball, and Catch. {Hopscotch}has been played by generations of children and it is played as follows: It is a game played on a grid, marked on the ground in chalk. The grid is made up of several numbered squares set out in a one and two or in a rectangle 2x5. The object of the game is to complete the grid by first taking turns at throwing a small stone onto a square, starting at no.1, and hopping and jumping in the case of the first example, hopping in the case of the scond, up to the stone, picking it up, and coming back as before.
